options.label: B

multiple-choice.question: What is the main objective of the aliens in the scenario?

options.label: B

options.text: The aliens will eat some captives and spare others

options.label: C

options.text: They will have to go hungry

options.label: C

title: Democracy - A short introduction

multiple-choice.question: What does the word "democracy" originate from?

options.label: A

options.label: C
options.text: It established the principle that even the king was not above the law

options.label: D
options.text: It introduced the concept of direct democracy

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between direct and indirect democracy?

options.label: A
options.text: Direct democracy involves voting on laws directly, while indirect democracy involves voting for representatives

options.label: B
options.text: Direct democracy involves voting for representatives, while indirect democracy involves voting on laws directly

options.label: C
options.text: Direct democracy is more common in modern times, while indirect democracy is more common in ancient times

options.label: D
options.text: Direct democracy is more common in small countries, while indirect democracy is more common in large countries

options.label: B
options.text: It refers to the interests of the minority

options.label: C
options.text: It refers to the values and wishes of the society as a whole

options.label: D
options.text: It refers to the power of the government

options.label: B
options.text: The minority always has the most power

options.label: C
options.text: Voting is always fair and just

options.label: D
options.text: The government always makes decisions based on the general will

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: To ensure that the government is efficient and effective

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: To advise the government on policy decisions

options.label: B
options.text: It has been modified to suit modern times

options.label: C
options.text: It remains an important document that establishes the principle of due process

options.label: D
options.text: It has been replaced by a new document

title: When to use "me", "myself" and "I" - Emma Bryce

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of "I" in a sentence?
Which of the following sentences is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: I invited her, but she invited me.

options.label: B
options.text: Me invited her, but she invited me.

options.label: C
options.text: I danced around her, while she shimmied up to me.

options.label: D
options.text: Me danced around her, while she shimmied up to me.

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of "myself" in the sentence "I consider myself the most important pronoun at this year's party"?
In what context can "myself" be used as an intensive pronoun?
What is the primary difference between subject and object pronouns?

options.label: A
options.text: Subject pronouns are the actors in a sentence, while object pronouns are the words that are acted upon.

options.label: B
options.text: Subject pronouns are the words that are acted upon, while object pronouns are the actors in a sentence.

options.label: C
options.text: Subject pronouns are used to add emphasis, while object pronouns are used to reflect the subject.

options.label: D
options.text: Subject pronouns are used to reflect the subject, while object pronouns are used to add emphasis.

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following sentences is correct?

options.label: D
options.text: Both B and C are correct.

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of "myself" in the sentence "I, myself, have heard others agree"?
What is the primary function of "me" in a sentence?
Which of the following sentences is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: I danced around her, while she shimmied up to me.

options.label: B
options.text: Me danced around her, while she shimmied up to me.

options.label: C
options.text: I invited me to the party.

multiple-choice.question: What is the key to using "I," "me," and "myself" correctly?

options.label: A
options.text: Identifying the subject and object of a sentence.
